title: Herb patch

properties.name: description
properties.value: Herb patches are Farming patches in which players can grow herbs. Herbs are primarily used in the Herblore skill. Most herb patches also have a compost bin, a tool leprechaun, an allotment and a flower patch nearby. All herbs take 80 minutes to grow before you can harvest them. Each patch requires one seed to begin growing that herb type. You need a seed dibber to plant a herb, and a spade to harvest herbs.

content:
Herb patches are Farming patches in which players can grow herbs. Herbs are primarily used in the Herblore skill. Most herb patches also have a compost bin, a tool leprechaun, an allotment and a flower patch nearby. All herbs take 80 minutes to grow before you can harvest them. Each patch requires one seed to begin growing that herb type. You need a seed dibber to plant a herb, and a spade to harvest herbs.

Unlike allotments, there is no way to protect herbs from disease, unless using a disease-free patch. Players can check on the herbs regularly and apply plant cure if needed to save a diseased plant. It is highly recommended to use ultracompost on valuable herb crops, as it will greatly reduce the death risk and you will always get at least 6 herbs per seed provided it doesn't die. Yield boosting equipment such as the magic secateurs is also highly beneficial to players.

Contents

  • 1 Bonuses
  • 2 Herb seeds
  • 3 Herb patches
  • 4 Changes
  • 5 See also
  • 6 References

Bonuses[edit | edit source]

Many herb patches possess unique bonuses either after unlocking or once a requirement is fulfilled:

  • 10% increased xp using the patch south of Falador after completing the Medium Falador diary.
  • 5, 10, and 15% extra yield using the patch north of Catherby with completion of the medium, hard, and elite Kandarin diaries respectively.
  • 5% extra yield using the patch in the second tier of the Farming guild with completion of the hard Kourend & Kebos Diary.
  • 5% extra yield using the patch in Hosidius with completion of the hard Kourend & Kebos Diary.
  • 10% extra yield on all herb patches when wielding Magic secateurs.
  • 5% extra yield on all herb patches when wearing a Farming cape.
  • 5% extra chance to save a life on all herb patches with a planted Attas seed.[1]
  • Disease-free patches Trollheim and Weiss unlocked with My Arm's Big Adventure and Making Friends with My Arm respectively.
  • Disease-free patch in Hosidius with 50% Hosidius favour.

  3. ^ This experience is gained upon harvesting the final herb, rather than when planting the seed.
  4. ^ Assume 7 herbs are picked.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
28 April 2016
(update | poll)

It is now possible to add compost or supercompost to any farming patch during any growth stage of a crop.

18 June 2015
(update)

The increased herb yields from Catherby herb patch and better chances at higher ores when cleaning pay-dirt diary rewards are now correctly being applied.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

• There is now a herb patch located on Harmony Island that you can use if you have completed the Morytania Elite Diary.

• You now receive increased yields from the Catherby herb patch for the completion of Kandarin Diaries:

  • 5% more for the medium diary.
  • 10% more for the hard diary.
  • 15% more for the elite diary.

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Farming/Patch locations
  • Herb yield

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 26 November 2019. (Archived from the original on 25 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Percentage reduction on losing a life at each roll - specifically 5%."

rawContent:
'''Herb patches''' are [[Farming]] patches in which players can grow [[herb]]s. Herbs are primarily used in the [[Herblore]] skill. Most herb patches also have a [[compost bin]], a [[tool leprechaun]], an [[allotment]] and a [[Farming/Patch locations|flower patch]] nearby. All herbs take 80 minutes to grow before you can harvest them. Each patch requires '''one seed''' to begin growing that herb type. You need a seed dibber to plant a herb, and a spade to harvest herbs. Unlike [[allotment]]s, there is '''no way''' to protect herbs from disease, unless using a disease-free patch. Players can check on the herbs regularly and apply [[plant cure]] if needed to save a diseased plant. It is highly recommended to use [[ultracompost]] on valuable herb crops, as it will greatly reduce the death risk and you will always get at least 6 herbs per seed provided it doesn't die. Yield boosting equipment such as the [[magic secateurs]] is also highly beneficial to players. ==Bonuses== Many herb patches possess unique bonuses either after unlocking or once a requirement is fulfilled: *10% increased xp using the patch south of [[Falador]] after completing the [[Medium Falador]] diary. *5, 10, and 15% extra yield using the patch north of [[Catherby]] with completion of the medium, hard, and elite [[Kandarin Diary|Kandarin diaries]] respectively. *5% extra yield using the patch in the second tier of the [[Farming guild]] with completion of the hard [[Kourend & Kebos Diary]]. *5% extra yield using the patch in [[Hosidius]] with completion of the hard [[Kourend & Kebos Diary]]. *10% extra yield on all herb patches when wielding [[Magic secateurs]]. *5% extra yield on all herb patches when wearing a [[Farming cape]]. *5% extra chance to save a [[Farming#Variable crop yield|life]] on all herb patches with a planted [[Attas seed]].{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1199288075186294784|date=26 November 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/KA7Dw|archivedate=25 May 2020|quote=Percentage reduction on losing a life at each roll - specifically 5%.}} *Disease-free patches [[Trollheim]] and [[Weiss]] unlocked with [[My Arm's Big Adventure]] and [[Making Friends with My Arm]] respectively. *Disease-free patch in [[Hosidius]] with 50% Hosidius [[favour]]. {{:Herb patch/Seeds}} {{:Allotment patch/Patches|herb=yes|title=Herb}} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 28 April 2016 |update = Calling Pets & Deadman Death |poll = Old School Content Poll 41: Bank placeholders & Skillcapes |change = It is now possible to add compost or supercompost to any farming patch during any growth stage of a crop. }} {{Subject changes |date = 18 June 2015 |update = Multiple Clues & Midsummer |change = The increased herb yields from Catherby herb patch and better chances at higher ores when cleaning pay-dirt diary rewards are now correctly being applied. }} {{Subject changes |date = 5 March 2015 |update = Achievement Diaries |poll = Old School Achievement Diary Rewards Poll |change = {{*}} There is now a herb patch located on [[Harmony Island]] that you can use if you have completed the [[Morytania Elite Diary]].

{{*}} You now receive increased yields from the [[Catherby]] herb patch for the completion of [[Kandarin Diary|Kandarin Diaries]]: *5% more for the [[Kandarin Medium|medium diary]]. *10% more for the [[Kandarin Hard Diary|hard diary]]. *15% more for the [[Kandarin Elite|elite diary]]. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ==See also== *[[Farming/Patch locations]] *[[Herb yield]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Farming patches}}
